revised_title: Determination of the Equilibrium Conformation and Out-of-Plane Bending Potential Energy Function of the Hydrogen-Bonded H2O-HF Dimer
tldr: The authors investigated the hydrogen bonding interactions in the gas phase by studying the equilibrium conformation and out-of-plane bending potential energy function of the hydrogen-bonded H2O-HF dimer using its microwave rotational spectrum. They found that the equilibrium configuration at the oxygen atom is pyramidal, and the potential energy function has a double minimum with a barrier of 126 separating the pyramidal equilibrium conformations.
